member.summary: Defines the method of mixing the colors with the backdrop (source and destination colors).

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.BlendMode.Normal
member.summary: This is the default attribute which specifies no blending.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.BlendMode.Multiply
member.summary:
The source color is multiplied by the destination color and replaces the destination.
The resultant color is always at least as dark as either the source or destination color.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.BlendMode.Screen
member.summary:
Multiplies the complements of the backdrop and source color values, then complements the result.
The result color is always at least as light as either of the two constituent colors.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.BlendMode.Overlay
member.summary:
Multiplies or screens the colors, depending on the backdrop color value.
Source colors overlay the backdrop while preserving its highlights and shadows.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.BlendMode.Darken
member.summary:
Selects the darker of the backdrop and source colors.
The backdrop is replaced with the source where the source is darker; otherwise, it is left unchanged.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.BlendMode.Lighten
member.summary:
Selects the lighter of the backdrop and source colors.
The backdrop is replaced with the source where the source is lighter; otherwise, it is left unchanged.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.BlendMode.ColorDodge
member.summary:
Brightens the backdrop color to reflect the source color.
Painting with black produces no changes.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.BlendMode.ColorBurn
member.summary:
Darkens the backdrop color to reflect the source color.
Painting with white produces no change.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.BlendMode.HardLight
member.summary:
Multiplies or screens the colors, depending on the source color value.
The effect is similar to shining a harsh spotlight on the backdrop.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.BlendMode.SoftLight
member.summary:
Darkens or lightens the colors, depending on the source color value.
The effect is similar to shining a diffused spotlight on the backdrop.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.BlendMode.Difference
member.summary:
Subtracts the darker of the two constituent colors from the lighter color.
Painting with white inverts the backdrop color; painting with black produces no change.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.BlendMode.Exclusion
member.summary:
Produces an effect similar to that of the Difference mode but lower in contrast.
Painting with white inverts the backdrop color; painting with black produces no change.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.BlendMode.Hue
member.summary: Creates a color with the hue of the source color and the saturation and luminosity of the backdrop color.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.BlendMode.Saturation
member.summary:
Creates a color with the saturation of the source color and the hue and luminosity of the backdrop color.
Painting with this mode in an area of the backdrop that is a pure gray (no saturation) produces no change.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.BlendMode.Color
member.summary:
Creates a color with the hue and saturation of the source color and the luminosity of the backdrop color.
This preserves the gray levels of the backdrop and is useful for coloring monochrome images or tinting color images.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.BlendMode.Luminosity
member.summary:
Creates a color with the luminosity of the source color and the hue and saturation of the backdrop color.
This produces an inverse effect to that of the Color mode.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.ColorChannel
member.summary: Specifies the color channel to operate on.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.ColorChannel.Blue
member.summary: The Blue channel is chosen.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.ColorChannel.Green
member.summary: The Green channel is chosen.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.ColorChannel.Red
member.summary: The Red channel is chosen.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.ColorChannel.Alpha
member.summary: The Alpha channel is chosen.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.CompositeMode
member.summary: Specifies the Porter Duff compositing method in which two pixels (source and destination) may contribute to the final color of the pixel.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.CompositeMode.Clear
member.summary: No regions are enabled.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.CompositeMode.Copy
member.summary: Only the source will be present.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.CompositeMode.Destination
member.summary: Only the destination will be present.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.CompositeMode.SourceOver
member.summary: Source is placed over the destination.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.CompositeMode.DestinationOver
member.summary: Destination is placed over the source.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.CompositeMode.SourceIn
member.summary: The source that overlaps the destination, replaces the destination.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.CompositeMode.DestinationIn
member.summary: Destination which overlaps the source, replaces the source.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.CompositeMode.SourceOut
member.summary: Source is placed, where it falls outside of the destination.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.CompositeMode.DestinationOut
member.summary: Destination is placed, where it falls outside of the source.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.CompositeMode.SourceAtop
member.summary: Source which overlaps the destination, replaces the destination. Destination is placed elsewhere.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.CompositeMode.DestinationAtop
member.summary: Destination which overlaps the source replaces the source. Source is placed elsewhere.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.CompositeMode.XOR
member.summary: The non-overlapping regions of source and destination are combined.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.CompositeMode.Lighter
member.summary: Display the sum of the source image and destination image.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.DitheringMethod
member.summary: Specifies the method of two-dimensional error diffusion dithering.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.DitheringMethod.NoDithering
member.summary: Don't spread the error to neighbor pixels.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.DitheringMethod.FloydSteinberg
member.summary: Floyd-Steinberg dithering.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.DitheringMethod.JarvisJudiceNinke
member.summary: Jarvis, Judice, and Ninke filter.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.DitheringMethod.Stucki
member.summary: Stucki dithering.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.DitheringMethod.Atkinson
member.summary: Bill Atkinson's formula.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.DitheringMethod.Burkes
member.summary: Burkes dithering.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.DitheringMethod.Sierra
member.summary: Frankie Sierra's dithering algorithm (sometimes called Sierra-3).

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.DitheringMethod.TwoRowSierra
member.summary: Simplified two-row Sierra algorithm.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.DitheringMethod.SierraLite
member.summary: Sierra Lite dithering.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.FlipRotateAction
member.summary: Specifies the flip and rotation transformations.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.FlipRotateAction.None
member.summary: No transformation.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.FlipRotateAction.Rotate90
member.summary: A clockwise rotation of 90 degrees.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.FlipRotateAction.Rotate180
member.summary: A clockwise rotation of 180 degrees.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.FlipRotateAction.Rotate270
member.summary: A counter-clockwise rotation of 90 degrees.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.FlipRotateAction.FlipHorizontal
member.summary: A horizontal flip. Pixels are flipped around the vertical y-axis.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.FlipRotateAction.FlipHRotate90
member.summary: A horizontal flip, then a clockwise rotation of 90 degrees.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.FlipRotateAction.FlipHRotate270
member.summary: A horizontal flip, then a counter-clockwise rotation of 90 degrees.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.FlipRotateAction.FlipVertical
member.summary: A vertical flip. Pixels are flipped around the horizontal x-axis.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.GifDisposalMethod
member.summary: Indicates the way in which the GIF frame has to be treated after being displayed.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.GifDisposalMethod.NotSpecified
member.summary: No disposal specified. The decoder is not required to take any action.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.GifDisposalMethod.DoNotDispose
member.summary: Do not dispose. The graphic is to be left in place.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.GifDisposalMethod.RestoreToBackgroundColor
member.summary: Restore to background color. The area used by the graphic must be restored to the background color.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.GifDisposalMethod.RestoreToPrevious
member.summary: Restore to previous. The decoder is required to restore the area overwritten by the graphic with what was there prior to rendering the graphic.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.GrayscaleStandard
member.summary: Specifies the standard used for converting full-color image to monochromatic gray.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.GrayscaleStandard.BT601
member.summary: Corresponds to the standard color TV and video systems such as PAL and NTSC.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.GrayscaleStandard.BT709
member.summary: Corresponds to the ITU-R BT.709 standard used for HDTV.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.GrayscaleStandard.BT2100
member.summary: Corresponds to the ITU-R BT.2100 standard for HDR television.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.InterpolationMode
member.summary: Specifies the sampling or filtering mode to use when scaling an image.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.InterpolationMode.NearestNeighbor
member.summary: A nearest neighbor interpolation algorithm. Also known as nearest pixel or point interpolation.
member.remarks: The output pixel is assigned the value of the pixel that the point falls within. No other pixels are considered.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.InterpolationMode.Linear
member.summary: A bilinear interpolation algorithm.
member.remarks: The output pixel values are computed as a weighted average of the nearest four pixels in a 2x2 grid. For downscaling by factors greater than 2 use the Downscale interpolation mode.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.InterpolationMode.Cubic
member.summary: A bicubic interpolation algorithm.
member.remarks: Destination pixel values are computed as a weighted average of the nearest sixteen pixels in a 4x4 grid. For downscaling by factors greater than 2 use the Downscale interpolation mode.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.InterpolationMode.Downscale
member.summary: A resampling algorithm for downscaling by factors greater than 2.
member.remarks: Destination pixel values are computed as a weighted average of the all the pixels that map to the new pixel.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.RegionCombineMode
member.summary: Specifies the different methods by which two regions can be combined.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.RegionCombineMode.Union
member.summary: The two regions are combined by taking the union of both.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.RegionCombineMode.Intersect
member.summary: The two regions are combined by taking their intersection.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.RegionCombineMode.Xor
member.summary: The two regions are combined by taking the area that exists in the first region but not the second and the area that exists in the second region but not the first.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.RegionCombineMode.Exclude
member.summary: The second region is excluded from the first.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffCompression
member.summary: Compression scheme used for encoding TIFF image data.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffCompression.DontCare
member.summary: Indicates a suitable compression algorithm based on the image and pixel format.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffCompression.NoCompression
member.summary: No compression, but pack data into bytes as tightly as possible, leaving no unused bits (except at the end of a row).

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffCompression.CCITT_1D
member.summary: CCITT Group 3 1-Dimensional Modified Huffman run length encoding.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffCompression.Group_3_Fax
member.summary: T4-encoding: CCITT T.4 bi-level encoding as specified in section 4, Coding, of CCITT Recommendation T.4: Standardization of Group 3 Facsimile apparatus for document transmission.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffCompression.Group_4_Fax
member.summary: T6-encoding: CCITT T.6 bi-level encoding as specified in section 2 of CCITT Recommendation T.6: Facsimile coding schemes and coding control functions for Group 4 facsimile apparatus.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffCompression.LZW
member.summary: An adaptive compression scheme for raster images.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffCompression.Deflate
member.summary: Deflate compression, using zlib data format.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffCompression.PackBits
member.summary: A simple byte-oriented runlength scheme.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffOrientation
member.summary: The orientation of the image.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffOrientation.TopLeft
member.summary: Normal horizontal (default).

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffOrientation.TopRight
member.summary: Mirror horizontal.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffOrientation.BottomRight
member.summary: Rotate 180 degrees.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffOrientation.BottomLeft
member.summary: Mirror vertical.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffOrientation.LeftTop
member.summary: Mirror horizontal and rotate 90 degrees counterclockwise.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffOrientation.RightTop
member.summary: Rotate 90 degrees clockwise.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffOrientation.RightBottom
member.summary: Mirror horizontal and rotate 90 degrees clockwise.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffOrientation.LeftBottom
member.summary: Rotate 90 degrees counterclockwise.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffValidationResult
member.summary: Specifies whether an image can be loaded from TIFF frame and the reason if it can't.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffValidationResult.Success
member.summary: No problems found. Image can be loaded from a .

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffValidationResult.IncompatibleCompressionScheme
member.summary: CCITT_1D, Group_3_Fax, and Group_4_Fax compression schemes are only supported for SamplesPerPixel = 1 and BitsPerSample = 1.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffValidationResult.MissingColorMap
member.summary: ColorMap is a required field for the RGB_Palette color space.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffValidationResult.MoreThanOneSamplePerPixel
member.summary: The specified color space (WhiteIsZero, BlackIsZero, TransparencyMask, or RGB_Palette) supports only one component (sample) per pixel.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffValidationResult.NoStripOffsetsOrByteCounts
member.summary: StripOffsets or StripByteCounts fields are missing (while TileWidth and TileLength are not defined).

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffValidationResult.NoTileOffsetsOrByteCounts
member.summary: TileOffsets or TileByteCounts fields are missing for a tiled TIFF frame.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffValidationResult.TileWidthIsNotMultipleOf16
member.summary: TileWidth must be a multiple of 16 (or at least of 8 for ).

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffValidationResult.UnexpectedBitsPerSample
member.summary: Unexpected value of the BitsPerSample field.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffValidationResult.UnexpectedExtraSamples
member.summary: Unexpected value of the ExtraSamples field. supports single associated or unassociated alpha component.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffValidationResult.UnsupportedCompressionScheme
member.summary: TIFF frame's compression scheme is not currently supported in .

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffValidationResult.UnsupportedDifferencingPredictor
member.summary: Differencing Predictor is supported for LZW and Deflate TIFF encoding schemes only.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffValidationResult.UnsupportedFillOrder
member.summary: FillOrder = 2 is only supported for SamplesPerPixel = 1 and BitsPerSample = 1.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffValidationResult.UnsupportedIndexedFormat
member.summary: Indexed images with BitsPerSample other than 4 or 8 are not currently supported in .

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffValidationResult.UnsupportedPhotometricInterpretation
member.summary: The specified color space of the image data is not currently supported in .

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffValidationResult.UnsupportedRGBFormat
member.summary: RGB images with SamplesPerPixel other than 3 or 4 are not currently supported in .

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffValidationResult.ZeroSizedFrameTile
member.summary: Either TileWidth or TileLength are equal to zero for a tiled TIFF frame.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.TiffValidationResult.ZeroSizedTiffFrame
member.summary: TIFF frame has either width or length equal to zero.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifDataType
member.summary: Data types used in Exif.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifDataType.Byte
member.summary: An 8-bit unsigned integer.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifDataType.Ascii
member.summary: An 8-bit byte containing one 7-bit ASCII code. The final byte is terminated with NULL.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifDataType.Short
member.summary: A 16-bit (2-byte) unsigned integer.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifDataType.Long
member.summary: A 32-bit (4-byte) unsigned integer.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifDataType.Rational
member.summary: Two LONGs. The first LONG is the numerator and the second LONG expresses the denominator.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifDataType.SByte
member.summary: An 8-bit signed (twos-complement) integer.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifDataType.Undefined
member.summary: An 8-bit byte that may take any value depending on the field definition.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifDataType.SShort
member.summary: A 16-bit (2-byte) signed (twos-complement) integer.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifDataType.SLong
member.summary: (4-byte) signed integer (2's complement notation).

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifDataType.SRational
member.summary: Two SLONGs. The first SLONG is the numerator and the second SLONG is the denominator.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifDataType.Float
member.summary: Single precision (4-byte) IEEE format.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifDataType.Double
member.summary: Double precision (8-byte) IEEE format.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifDataType.IFD
member.summary: Identical to LONG, but is only used to point to other valid IFDs.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.Flash
member.summary: Indicates the status of flash when the image was shot.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.FocalLength
member.summary: The actual focal length of the lens, in mm.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.SubjectArea
member.summary: Indicates the location and area of the main subject in the overall scene.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.MakerNote
member.summary: Manufacturer specific information.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.UserComment
member.summary: Keywords or comments on the image; complements ImageDescription.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.SubsecTime
member.summary: A tag used to record fractions of seconds for the DateTime tag.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.SubsecTimeOriginal
member.summary: A tag used to record fractions of seconds for the DateTimeOriginal tag.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.SubsecTimeDigitized
member.summary: A tag used to record fractions of seconds for the DateTimeDigitized tag.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.Temperature
member.summary: Temperature as the ambient situation at the shot, for example the room temperature where the photographer was holding the camera. The unit is C.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.Humidity
member.summary: Humidity as the ambient situation at the shot, for example the room humidity where the photographer was holding the camera. The unit is %.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.Pressure
member.summary: Pressure as the ambient situation at the shot, for example the room atmospfere where the photographer was holding the camera or the water pressure under the sea. The unit is hPa.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.WaterDepth
member.summary: Water depth as the ambient situation at the shot, for example the water depth of the camera at underwater photography. The unit is m.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.Acceleration
member.summary: Acceleration (a scalar regardless of direction) as the ambient situation at the shot, for example the driving acceleration of the vehicle which the photographer rode on at the shot. The unit is mGal (10-5 m/s2).

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.CameraElevationAngle
member.summary: Elevation/depression. Angle of the orientation of the camera (imaging optical axis) as the ambient situation at the shot. The unit is degree().

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.FlashpixVersion
member.summary: The Flashpix format version supported by a FPXR file.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.ColorSpace
member.summary: The color space information tag is always recorded as the color space specifier.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.PixelXDimension
member.summary: Specific to compressed data; the valid width of the meaningful image.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.PixelYDimension
member.summary: Specific to compressed data; the valid height of the meaningful image.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.RelatedSoundFile
member.summary: Used to record the name of an audio file related to the image data.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.FlashEnergy
member.summary: Indicates the strobe energy at the time the image is captured, as measured in Beam Candle Power Seconds.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.SpatialFrequencyResponse
member.summary: Records the camera or input device spatial frequency table and SFR values in the direction of image width, image height, and diagonal direction, as specified in ISO 12233.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.FocalPlaneXResolution
member.summary: Indicates the number of pixels in the image width (X) direction per FocalPlaneResolutionUnit on the camera focal plane.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.FocalPlaneYResolution
member.summary: Indicates the number of pixels in the image height (Y) direction per FocalPlaneResolutionUnit on the camera focal plane.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.FocalPlaneResolutionUnit
member.summary: Indicates the unit for measuring FocalPlaneXResolution and FocalPlaneYResolution.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.SubjectLocation
member.summary: Indicates the location of the main subject in the scene.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.ExposureIndex
member.summary: Indicates the exposure index selected on the camera or input device at the time the image is captured.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.SensingMethod
member.summary: Indicates the image sensor type on the camera or input device.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.FileSource
member.summary: Indicates the image source.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.SceneType
member.summary: Indicates the type of scene.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.CFAPattern
member.summary: Indicates the color filter array (CFA) geometric pattern of the image sensor when a one-chip color area sensor is used.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.CustomRendered
member.summary: Indicates the use of special processing on image data, such as rendering geared to output.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.ExposureMode
member.summary: Indicates the exposure mode set when the image was shot.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.WhiteBalance
member.summary: Indicates the white balance mode set when the image was shot.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.DigitalZoomRatio
member.summary: Indicates the digital zoom ratio when the image was shot.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.FocalLengthIn35mmFilm
member.summary: Indicates the equivalent focal length assuming a 35mm film camera, in mm.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.SceneCaptureType
member.summary: Indicates the type of scene that was shot.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.GainControl
member.summary: Indicates the degree of overall image gain adjustment.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.Contrast
member.summary: Indicates the direction of contrast processing applied by the camera when the image was shot.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.Saturation
member.summary: Indicates the direction of saturation processing applied by the camera when the image was shot.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.Sharpness
member.summary: Indicates the direction of sharpness processing applied by the camera when the image was shot.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.DeviceSettingDescription
member.summary: This tag indicates information on the picture-taking conditions of a particular camera model.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.SubjectDistanceRange
member.summary: Indicates the distance to the subject.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.ImageUniqueID
member.summary: Indicates an identifier assigned uniquely to each image.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.CameraOwnerName
member.summary: This tag records the owner of a camera used in photography.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.BodySerialNumber
member.summary: This tag records the serial number of the body of the camera that was used in photography.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.LensSpecification
member.summary: This tag notes minimum focal length, maximum focal length, minimum F number in the minimum focal length, and minimum F number in the maximum focal length, which are specification information for the lens that was used in photography.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.LensMake
member.summary: This tag records the lens manufacturer.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.LensModel
member.summary: This tag records the lenss model name and model number.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.LensSerialNumber
member.summary: This tag records the serial number of the interchangeable lens that was used in photography.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.Gamma
member.summary: Indicates the value of coefficient gamma.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.GpsVersionID
member.summary: Indicates the version of GPSInfoIFD.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.GpsLatitudeRef
member.summary: Indicates whether the latitude is north or south latitude.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.GpsLatitude
member.summary: Indicates the latitude.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.GpsLongitudeRef
member.summary: Indicates whether the longitude is east or west longitude.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.GpsLongitude
member.summary: Indicates the longitude.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.GpsAltitudeRef
member.summary: Indicates the altitude used as the reference altitude.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.GpsAltitude
member.summary: Indicates the altitude based on the reference in GPSAltitudeRef.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.GpsTimeStamp
member.summary: Indicates the time as UTC (Coordinated Universal Time). TimeStamp is expressed as three RATIONAL values giving the hour, minute, and second.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.GpsSatellites
member.summary: Indicates the GPS satellites used for measurements.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.GpsStatus
member.summary: Indicates the status of the GPS receiver when the image is recorded.

member.summary: Indicates the GPS measurement mode.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTag.GpsDOP
member.summary: Indicates the GPS DOP (data degree of precision).

member.summary: Indicates the unit used to express the GPS receiver speed of movement.

member.summary: Indicates the speed of GPS receiver movement.

member.summary: Indicates the reference for giving the direction of GPS receiver movement.

member.summary: Indicates the direction of GPS receiver movement.

member.summary: Indicates the reference for giving the direction of the image when it is captured.

member.summary: Indicates the direction of the image when it was captured.

member.summary: Indicates the latitude of the destination point.

member.summary: Indicates the bearing to the destination point.

member.summary: Indicates the distance to the destination point.

member.summary: Exif tags that follow the TIFF structure.

member.summary: The number of columns in the image, i.e., the number of pixels per row.

member.summary: The number of rows of pixels in the image.

member.summary: Number of bits per component.

member.summary: Compression scheme used on the image data.

member.summary: The color space of the image data.

member.summary: A string that describes the subject of the image.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTiffTag.Make
member.summary: The scanner manufacturer.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTiffTag.Model
member.summary: The scanner model name or number.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifTiffTag.StripOffsets
member.summary: For each strip, the byte offset of that strip.

member.summary: The orientation of the image with respect to the rows and columns.

member.summary: The number of components per pixel.

member.summary: The number of rows per strip.

member.summary: For each strip, the number of bytes in the strip after compression.

member.summary: The number of pixels per ResolutionUnit in the ImageLength direction.

member.summary: How the components of each pixel are stored.

member.summary: Date and time of image creation.

member.summary: Exposure time, given in seconds.

member.summary: The F number.

member.summary: The class of the program used by the camera to set exposure when the picture is taken.

member.summary: Indicates the spectral sensitivity of each channel of the camera used.

member.summary: This tag indicates the standard output sensitivity value of a camera or input device defined in ISO 12232.

member.summary: This tag indicates the recommended exposure index value of a camera or input device defined in ISO 12232.

member.summary: This tag indicates the ISO speed value of a camera or input device that is defined in ISO 12232.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifSpecificTag.ISOSpeedLatitudeyyy
member.summary: This tag indicates the ISO speed latitude yyy value of a camera or input device that is defined in ISO 12232.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifSpecificTag.ISOSpeedLatitudezzz
member.summary: This tag indicates the ISO speed latitude zzz value of a camera or input device that is defined in ISO 12232.

member.summary: The version of the supported Exif standard.

member.summary: The date and time when the original image data was generated.

member.summary: The date and time when the image was stored as digital data.

member.summary: A tag used to record the offset from UTC (the time difference from Universal Time Coordinated including daylight saving time) of the time of DateTime tag.

member.summary: A tag used to record the offset from UTC (the time difference from Universal Time Coordinated including daylight saving time) of the time of DateTimeOriginal tag.

member.summary: A tag used to record the offset from UTC (the time difference from Universal Time Coordinated including daylight saving time) of the time of DateTimeDigitized tag.

member.summary: Specific to compressed data; specifies the channels and complements PhotometricInterpretation.

member.summary: The metering mode.

member.summary: A tag used to record fractions of seconds for the DateTimeDigitized tag.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifSpecificTag.Temperature
member.summary: Temperature as the ambient situation at the shot, for example the room temperature where the photographer was holding the camera. The unit is C.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifSpecificTag.Humidity
member.summary: Humidity as the ambient situation at the shot, for example the room humidity where the photographer was holding the camera. The unit is %.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifSpecificTag.Pressure
member.summary: Pressure as the ambient situation at the shot, for example the room atmospfere where the photographer was holding the camera or the water pressure under the sea. The unit is hPa.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifSpecificTag.WaterDepth
member.summary: Water depth as the ambient situation at the shot, for example the water depth of the camera at underwater photography. The unit is m.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifSpecificTag.Acceleration
member.summary: Acceleration (a scalar regardless of direction) as the ambient situation at the shot, for example the driving acceleration of the vehicle which the photographer rode on at the shot. The unit is mGal (10-5 m/s2).

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.Exif.ExifSpecificTag.CameraElevationAngle
member.summary: Elevation/depression. Angle of the orientation of the camera (imaging optical axis) as the ambient situation at the shot. The unit is degree().

member.summary: The Flashpix format version supported by a FPXR file.

member.summary: The color space information tag is always recorded as the color space specifier.

member.summary: Specific to compressed data; the valid width of the meaningful image.

member.summary: Specific to compressed data; the valid height of the meaningful image.

member.summary: Interoperability tag.

member.summary: Initializes an empty instance of the class.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.GcBitmap.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary:
Initializes a new instance of the class and creates the image.
The image content is not initialized and can contain any random data.
If subsequent rendering is going to cover the whole surface of the bitmap, or if will be called on the bitmap with a non-null background color, clearing it (which is a lengthy operation for large bitmaps) is not needed. If some areas of the bitmap are going to be left untouched, they must be cleared to avoid the possibility of random artifacts showing.
member.param: The width of the image, in pixels.
The height of the image, in pixels.
Indicates whether the alpha channel should be ignored.
The horizontal dpi of the image.
The vertical dpi of the image.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.GcBitmap.CreateImage(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary:
Creates the image of the given size and resolution.
The content is not initialized and can contain any random data.
If subsequent rendering is going to cover the whole surface of the bitmap, or if will be called on the bitmap with a non-null background color, clearing it (which is a lengthy operation for large bitmaps) is not needed. If some areas of the bitmap are going to be left untouched, they must be cleared to avoid the possibility of random artifacts showing.
member.param: The width of the image, in pixels.
The height of the image, in pixels.
Indicates if the alpha channel should be ignored.
The horizontal dpi of the image.
The vertical dpi of the image.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.GcBitmap.ToBilevelBitmap(GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.ColorChannel,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Creates a from the current .
This method does not perform any transformations of the color palette. It is expected that the source has already been converted to bi-level palette using some thresholding or dithering effects. The method just copies data from a specified color channel to a new instance of the class.
member.param: The color channel used as the source of the bi-level data.
If true, pixels are arranged within a byte such that pixels with lower column indices are stored in the lower-order bits of the byte.
If true, indicates that 0 represents white and 1 represents black in the resulting .

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.GcBitmap.ToGrayscaleBitmap(GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.ColorChannel,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Creates a from the current .
This method does not perform any transformations of the color palette. It is expected that the source has already been converted to grayscale palette using a or something like that. Alternatively, you can use this method to extract individual channels of a color image without any prior conversion, and treat the resulting simply as a representation of some image data with 8 bits per pixel. The method just copies data from a specified color channel to a new instance of the class. If you need to copy some color channel to an existing instance of , use the method instead.
member.param: The color channel used as the source of grayscale data.
If true, indicates that 0 represents white and 255 represents black in the resulting .

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.ColorSpaces.Conversion.ColorSpaceConverter.WhitePoint
member.summary: Gets or sets the white point used for chromatic adaptation in conversions from/to XYZ color space. When null, no adaptation will be performed.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.ColorSpaces.Conversion.ColorSpaceConverter.TargetLuvWhitePoint
member.summary: Gets or sets the white point used *when creating* Luv/LChuv colors. (Luv/LChuv colors on the input already contain the white point information) Defaults to: .

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.ColorSpaces.Conversion.ColorSpaceConverter.TargetLabWhitePoint
member.summary: Gets or sets the white point used *when creating* Lab/LChab colors. (Lab/LChab colors on the input already contain the white point information) Defaults to: .

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.ColorSpaces.Conversion.ColorSpaceConverter.TargetHunterLabWhitePoint
member.summary: Gets or sets the white point used *when creating* HunterLab colors. (HunterLab colors on the input already contain the white point information) Defaults to: .

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.ColorSpaces.Conversion.ColorSpaceConverter.TargetRgbWorkingSpace
member.summary: Gets or sets the target working space used *when creating* RGB colors. (RGB colors on the input already contain the working space information) Defaults to: .

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.ColorSpaces.Conversion.ColorSpaceConverter.ChromaticAdaptation
member.summary: Gets or sets the chromatic adaptation method used. When null, no adaptation will be performed.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.ColorSpaces.Conversion.ColorSpaceConverter.LmsAdaptationMatrix
member.summary: Gets or sets transformation matrix used in conversion to , also used in the default Von Kries Chromatic Adaptation method.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Bmp.BmpCompression.RGB
member.summary: Each image row has a multiple of four elements. If the row has less elements, zeros will be added at the right side. The format depends on the number of bits, stored in the info header. If the number of bits are one, four or eight each pixel data is a index to the palette. If the number of bits are sixteen, twenty-four or thirty-two each pixel contains a color.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Bmp.BmpCompression.RLE8
member.summary: Two bytes are one data record. If the first byte is not zero, the next two half bytes will be repeated as much as the value of the first byte. If the first byte is zero, the record has different meanings, depending on the second byte. If the second byte is zero, it is the end of the row, if it is one, it is the end of the image. Not supported at the moment.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Bmp.BmpCompression.RLE4
member.summary: Two bytes are one data record. If the first byte is not zero, the next byte will be repeated as much as the value of the first byte. If the first byte is zero, the record has different meanings, depending on the second byte. If the second byte is zero, it is the end of the row, if it is one, it is the end of the image. Not supported at the moment.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Bmp.BmpCompression.BitFields
member.summary: Each image row has a multiple of four elements. If the row has less elements, zeros will be added at the right side. Not supported at the moment.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Bmp.BmpCompression.JPEG
member.summary: The bitmap contains a JPG image. Not supported at the moment.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Bmp.BmpCompression.PNG
member.summary: The bitmap contains a PNG image. Not supported at the moment.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Bmp.BmpDecoder
member.summary: Image decoder for generating an image out of a Windows bitmap stream.
member.remarks:
Does not support the following formats at the moment:
JPG
PNG
RLE4
RLE8
BitFields
Formats will be supported in a later releases. We advise always to use only 24 Bit Windows bitmaps.

Quantize 'block' into 'dest' using the 'qt' quantization table: Unzig the elements of block into dest, while dividing them by elements of qt and "pre-rounding" the values. To finish the rounding it's enough to (int)-cast these values.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Jpeg.Components.Decoder.JpegImagePostProcessor
member.summary:
Encapsulates the execution od post-processing algorithms to be applied on a to produce a valid :
(1) Dequantization
(2) IDCT
(3) Color conversion form one of the -s into a buffer of RGBA values
(4) Packing pixels from the buffer.
These operations are executed in steps. image rows are converted in one step, which means that size of the allocated memory is limited (does not depend on ).

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Jpeg.Components.ZigZag
member.summary: Holds the Jpeg UnZig array in a value/stack type. Unzig maps from the zigzag ordering to the natural ordering. For example, unzig[3] is the column and row of the fourth element in zigzag order. The value is 16, which means first column (16%8 == 0) and third row (16/8 == 2).

member.summary: The text comment marker

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Jpeg.JpegConstants.Markers.DQT
member.summary:
Define Quantization Table(s) marker
Specifies one or more quantization tables.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Jpeg.JpegConstants.Markers.SOF0
member.summary:
Start of Frame (baseline DCT)
Indicates that this is a baseline DCT-based JPEG, and specifies the width, height, number of components, and component subsampling (e.g., 4:2:0).

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Jpeg.JpegConstants.Markers.SOF1
member.summary:
Start Of Frame (Extended Sequential DCT)
Indicates that this is a progressive DCT-based JPEG, and specifies the width, height, number of components, and component subsampling (e.g., 4:2:0).

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Jpeg.JpegConstants.Markers.SOF2
member.summary:
Start Of Frame (progressive DCT)
Indicates that this is a progressive DCT-based JPEG, and specifies the width, height, number of components, and component subsampling (e.g., 4:2:0).

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Jpeg.JpegConstants.Markers.DHT
member.summary:
Define Huffman Table(s)
Specifies one or more Huffman tables.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Jpeg.JpegConstants.Markers.DRI
member.summary:
Define Restart Interval
Specifies the interval between RSTn markers, in macroblocks.This marker is followed by two bytes indicating the fixed size so it can be treated like any other variable size segment.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Jpeg.JpegConstants.Markers.SOS
member.summary:
Start of Scan
Begins a top-to-bottom scan of the image. In baseline DCT JPEG images, there is generally a single scan. Progressive DCT JPEG images usually contain multiple scans. This marker specifies which slice of data it will contain, and is immediately followed by entropy-coded data.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Jpeg.JpegConstants.Markers.RST0
member.summary:
Define First Restart
Inserted every r macroblocks, where r is the restart interval set by a DRI marker. Not used if there was no DRI marker. The low three bits of the marker code cycle in value from 0 to 7.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Jpeg.JpegConstants.Markers.RST7
member.summary:
Define Eigth Restart
Inserted every r macroblocks, where r is the restart interval set by a DRI marker. Not used if there was no DRI marker. The low three bits of the marker code cycle in value from 0 to 7.

member.summary: The number of quantization tables.

member.summary: Counts the number of bits needed to hold an integer.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Jpeg.JpegEncoderCore.SosHeaderYCbCr
member.summary: The SOS (Start Of Scan) marker "\xff\xda" followed by 12 bytes: - the marker length "\x00\x0c", - the number of components "\x03", - component 1 uses DC table 0 and AC table 0 "\x01\x00", - component 2 uses DC table 1 and AC table 1 "\x02\x11", - component 3 uses DC table 1 and AC table 1 "\x03\x11", - the bytes "\x00\x3f\x00". Section B.2.3 of the spec says that for sequential DCTs, those bytes (8-bit Ss, 8-bit Se, 4-bit Ah, 4-bit Al) should be 0x00, 0x3f, 0x00<<4 | 0x00.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Jpeg.JpegEncoderCore.UnscaledQuant
member.summary: The unscaled quantization tables in zig-zag order. Each encoder copies and scales the tables according to its quality parameter. The values are derived from section K.1 after converting from natural to zig-zag order.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Jpeg.JpegSubsample.Ratio420
member.summary: Medium Quality - The horizontal sampling is halved and the Cb and Cr channels are only sampled on each alternate line.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.PngFilterMethod
member.summary: Provides enumeration of available PNG filter methods.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.PngFilterMethod.None
member.summary: With the None filter, the scanline is transmitted unmodified.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.PngFilterMethod.Sub
member.summary: The Sub filter transmits the difference between each byte and the value of the corresponding byte of the prior pixel.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.PngFilterMethod.Up
member.summary: The Up filter is just like the filter except that the pixel immediately above the current pixel, rather than just to its left, is used as the predictor.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.PngFilterMethod.Average
member.summary: The Average filter uses the average of the two neighboring pixels (left and above) to predict the value of a pixel.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.PngFilterMethod.Paeth
member.summary: The Paeth filter computes a simple linear function of the three neighboring pixels (left, above, upper left), then chooses as predictor the neighboring pixel closest to the computed value.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.PngFilterMethod.Adaptive
member.summary: Computes the output scanline using all five filters, and selects the filter that gives the smallest sum of absolute values of outputs. This method usually outperforms any single fixed filter choice.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.Filters.AverageFilter
member.summary: The Average filter uses the average of the two neighboring pixels (left and above) to predict the value of a pixel.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngChunk
member.summary: Stores header information about a chunk.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngChunk.Length
member.summary: Gets the length. An unsigned integer giving the number of bytes in the chunk's data field. The length counts only the data field, not itself, the chunk type code, or the CRC. Zero is a valid length

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngChunk.Type
member.summary: Gets the chunk type. The value is the equal to the UInt32BigEndian encoding of its 4 ASCII characters.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngChunk.Data
member.summary: Gets the data bytes appropriate to the chunk type, if any. This field can be of zero length or null.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngChunk.Crc
member.summary: Gets a CRC (Cyclic Redundancy Check) calculated on the preceding bytes in the chunk, including the chunk type code and chunk data fields, but not including the length field. The CRC is always present, even for chunks containing no data

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngChunk.IsCritical
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the given chunk is critical to decoding

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngChunkType
member.summary: Contains a list of chunk types.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngChunkType.Header
member.summary: The first chunk in a png file. Can only exists once. Contains common information like the width and the height of the image or the used compression method.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngChunkType.Palette
member.summary: The PLTE chunk contains from 1 to 256 palette entries, each a three byte series in the RGB format.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngChunkType.Data
member.summary: The IDAT chunk contains the actual image data. The image can contains more than one chunk of this type. All chunks together are the whole image.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngChunkType.End
member.summary: This chunk must appear last. It marks the end of the PNG data stream. The chunk's data field is empty.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngChunkType.PaletteAlpha
member.summary: This chunk specifies that the image uses simple transparency: either alpha values associated with palette entries (for indexed-color images) or a single transparent color (for grayscale and true color images).

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngChunkType.Text
member.summary: Textual information that the encoder wishes to record with the image can be stored in tEXt chunks. Each tEXt chunk contains a keyword and a text string.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngChunkType.Gamma
member.summary: This chunk specifies the relationship between the image samples and the desired display output intensity.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngChunkType.Physical
member.summary: The pHYs chunk specifies the intended pixel size or aspect ratio for display of the image.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngChunkType.Exif
member.summary: The data chunk which contains the Exif profile.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngChunkType.IccProfile
member.summary: Embedded ICC profile.

member.summary: Provides enumeration of available PNG color types.

member.summary: Each pixel is a grayscale sample.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngColorType.Rgb
member.summary: Each pixel is an R,G,B triple.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.PngDecoder
member.summary: Encoder for generating an image out of a png encoded stream.
member.remarks:
At the moment the following features are supported:
Filters: all filters are supported.
Pixel formats:
RGBA (True color) with alpha (8 bit).
RGB (True color) without alpha (8 bit).
grayscale with alpha (8 bit).
grayscale without alpha (8 bit).
Palette Index with alpha (8 bit).
Palette Index without alpha (8 bit).

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.Zlib.Adler32
member.summary: Computes Adler32 checksum for a stream of data. An Adler32 checksum is not as reliable as a CRC32 checksum, but a lot faster to compute.
member.remarks:
The specification for Adler32 may be found in RFC 1950. ZLIB Compressed Data Format Specification version 3.3)
From that document:
"ADLER32 (Adler-32 checksum) This contains a checksum value of the uncompressed data (excluding any dictionary data) computed according to Adler-32 algorithm. This algorithm is a 32-bit extension and improvement of the Fletcher algorithm, used in the ITU-T X.224 / ISO 8073 standard.
Adler-32 is composed of two sums accumulated per byte: s1 is the sum of all bytes, s2 is the sum of all s1 values. Both sums are done modulo 65521. s1 is initialized to 1, s2 to zero. The Adler-32 checksum is stored as s2*65536 + s1 in most- significant-byte first (network) order."
"8.2. The Adler-32 algorithm
The Adler-32 algorithm is much faster than the CRC32 algorithm yet still provides an extremely low probability of undetected errors.
The modulo on unsigned long accumulators can be delayed for 5552 bytes, so the modulo operation time is negligible. If the bytes are a, b, c, the second sum is 3a + 2b + c + 3, and so is position and order sensitive, unlike the first sum, which is just a checksum. That 65521 is prime is important to avoid a possible large class of two-byte errors that leave the check unchanged. (The Fletcher checksum uses 255, which is not prime and which also makes the Fletcher check insensitive to single byte changes 0 - 255.)
The sum s1 is initialized to 1 instead of zero to make the length of the sequence part of s2, so that the length does not have to be checked separately. (Any sequence of zeroes has a Fletcher checksum of zero.)"

member.summary: largest prime smaller than 65536

member.summary: The checksum calculated to far.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Formats.Png.Zlib.Crc32
member.summary: Generate a table for a byte-wise 32-bit CRC calculation on the polynomial: x^32+x^26+x^23+x^22+x^16+x^12+x^11+x^10+x^8+x^7+x^5+x^4+x^2+x+1.

remarks.para: Polynomials over GF(2) are represented in binary, one bit per coefficient, with the lowest powers in the most significant bit. Then adding polynomials is just exclusive-or, and multiplying a polynomial by x is a right shift by one. If we call the above polynomial p, and represent a byte as the polynomial q, also with the lowest power in the most significant bit (so the byte 0xb1 is the polynomial x^7+x^3+x+1), then the CRC is (q*x^32) mod p, where a mod b means the remainder after dividing a by b.

This calculation is done using the shift-register method of multiplying and taking the remainder. The register is initialized to zero, and for each incoming bit, x^32 is added mod p to the register if the bit is a one (where x^32 mod p is p+x^32 = x^26+...+1), and the register is multiplied mod p by x (which is shifting right by one and adding x^32 mod p if the bit shifted out is a one). We start with the highest power (least significant bit) of q and repeat for all eight bits of q.

The table is simply the CRC of all possible eight bit values. This is all the information needed to generate CRC's on data a byte at a time for all combinations of CRC register values and incoming bytes.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Memory.MemorySource`1
member.summary: Holds a that is either OWNED or CONSUMED. When the memory is being owned, the instance is also known. Implements content transfer logic in that depends on the ownership status. This is needed to transfer the contents of a temporary to a persistent without copying the buffer.
member.remarks:
For a deeper understanding of the owner/consumer model, check out the following docs:
https://gist.github.com/GrabYourPitchforks/4c3e1935fd4d9fa2831dbfcab35dffc6 https://www.codemag.com/Article/1807051/Introducing-.NET-Core-2.1-Flagship-Types-Span-T-and-Memory-T

member.summary: The text comment marker

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PdfJsPort.PdfJsJpegConstants.Markers.DQT
member.summary:
Define Quantization Table(s) marker
Specifies one or more quantization tables.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PdfJsPort.PdfJsJpegConstants.Markers.SOF0
member.summary:
Start of Frame (baseline DCT)
Indicates that this is a baseline DCT-based JPEG, and specifies the width, height, number of components, and component subsampling (e.g., 4:2:0).

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PdfJsPort.PdfJsJpegConstants.Markers.SOF1
member.summary:
Start Of Frame (Extended Sequential DCT)
Indicates that this is a progressive DCT-based JPEG, and specifies the width, height, number of components, and component subsampling (e.g., 4:2:0).

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PdfJsPort.PdfJsJpegConstants.Markers.SOF2
member.summary:
Start Of Frame (progressive DCT)
Indicates that this is a progressive DCT-based JPEG, and specifies the width, height, number of components, and component subsampling (e.g., 4:2:0).

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PdfJsPort.PdfJsJpegConstants.Markers.DHT
member.summary:
Define Huffman Table(s)
Specifies one or more Huffman tables.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PdfJsPort.PdfJsJpegConstants.Markers.DRI
member.summary:
Define Restart Interval
Specifies the interval between RSTn markers, in macroblocks.This marker is followed by two bytes indicating the fixed size so it can be treated like any other variable size segment.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PdfJsPort.PdfJsJpegConstants.Markers.SOS
member.summary:
Start of Scan
Begins a top-to-bottom scan of the image. In baseline DCT JPEG images, there is generally a single scan. Progressive DCT JPEG images usually contain multiple scans. This marker specifies which slice of data it will contain, and is immediately followed by entropy-coded data.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PdfJsPort.PdfJsJpegConstants.Markers.RST0
member.summary:
Define First Restart
Inserted every r macroblocks, where r is the restart interval set by a DRI marker. Not used if there was no DRI marker. The low three bits of the marker code cycle in value from 0 to 7.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PdfJsPort.PdfJsJpegConstants.Markers.RST7
member.summary:
Define Eigth Restart
Inserted every r macroblocks, where r is the restart interval set by a DRI marker. Not used if there was no DRI marker. The low three bits of the marker code cycle in value from 0 to 7.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PixelFormats.Argb32
member.summary:
Packed pixel type containing four 8-bit unsigned normalized values ranging from 0 to 255. The color components are stored in alpha, red, green, and blue order (least significant to most significant byte).
Ranges from [0, 0, 0, 0] to [1, 1, 1, 1] in vector form.
member.remarks: This struct is fully mutable. This is done (against the guidelines) for the sake of performance, as it avoids the need to create new values for modification operations.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PixelFormats.Rgba32
member.content: Provides optimized overrides for bulk operations.
member.summary:
Packed pixel type containing four 8-bit unsigned normalized values ranging from 0 to 255. The color components are stored in red, green, blue, and alpha order (least significant to most significant byte).
Ranges from [0, 0, 0, 0] to [1, 1, 1, 1] in vector form.
member.remarks: This struct is fully mutable. This is done (against the guidelines) for the sake of performance, as it avoids the need to create new values for modification operations.
member.content: Provides standardized definitions for named colors.
Provides optimized overrides for bulk operations.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PixelFormats.IPixel`1
member.summary: An interface that represents a generic pixel type. The naming convention of each pixel format is to order the color components from least significant to most significant, reading from left to right. For example in the pixel format the R component is the least significant byte, and the A component is the most significant.

member.summary: Enumerates the various blending modes.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PixelFormats.PixelBlenderMode.Normal
member.summary: Default blending mode, also known as "Normal" or "Alpha Blending"

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PixelFormats.PixelBlenderMode.Multiply
member.summary: Blends the 2 values by multiplication.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PixelFormats.PixelBlenderMode.Add
member.summary: Blends the 2 values by addition.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PixelFormats.PixelBlenderMode.Subtract
member.summary: Blends the 2 values by subtraction.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PixelFormats.PixelBlenderMode.Screen
member.summary: Multiplies the complements of the backdrop and source values, then complements the result.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PixelFormats.PixelBlenderMode.Darken
member.summary: Selects the minimum of the backdrop and source values.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PixelFormats.PixelBlenderMode.Lighten
member.summary: Selects the max of the backdrop and source values.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PixelFormats.PixelBlenderMode.Overlay
member.summary: Multiplies or screens the values, depending on the backdrop vector values.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PixelFormats.PixelBlenderMode.HardLight
member.summary: Multiplies or screens the colors, depending on the source value.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PixelFormats.PixelBlenderMode.Src
member.summary: returns the source colors.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PixelFormats.PixelBlenderMode.Atop
member.summary: returns the source over the destination.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PixelFormats.PixelBlenderMode.Over
member.summary: returns the destination over the source.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PixelFormats.PixelBlenderMode.In
member.summary: The source where the destination and source overlap.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PixelFormats.PixelBlenderMode.Out
member.summary: The destination where the destination and source overlap.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PixelFormats.PixelBlenderMode.Dest
member.summary: The destination where the source does not overlap it.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PixelFormats.PixelBlenderMode.DestAtop
member.summary: The source where they don't overlap othersie dest in overlapping parts.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PixelFormats.PixelBlenderMode.DestOver
member.summary: The destination over the source.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PixelFormats.PixelBlenderMode.DestIn
member.summary: The destination where the destination and source overlap.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PixelFormats.PixelBlenderMode.DestOut
member.summary: The source where the destination and source overlap.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PixelFormats.PixelBlenderMode.Clear
member.summary: The clear.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PixelFormats.PixelBlenderMode.Xor
member.summary: Clear where they overlap.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PixelFormats.PixelBlenders.DefaultPixelBlenders`1
member.summary: Collection of Porter Duff alpha blending functions applying different composition models.
member.remarks: These functions are designed to be a general solution for all color cases, that is, they take in account the alpha value of both the backdrop and source, and there's no need to alpha-premultiply neither the backdrop nor the source. Note there are faster functions for when the backdrop color is known to be opaque

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PixelFormats.PixelBlenders.PorterDuffFunctions
member.summary: Collection of Porter Duff alpha blending functions applying an the 'Over' composition model.
member.remarks: These functions are designed to be a general solution for all color cases, that is, they take in account the alpha value of both the backdrop and source, and there's no need to alpha-premultiply neither the backdrop nor the source. Note there are faster functions for when the backdrop color is known to be opaque

member.summary:

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.PixelFormats.RgbaVector
member.summary:
Unpacked pixel type containing four 16-bit floating-point values typically ranging from 0 to 1. The color components are stored in red, green, blue, and alpha order.
Ranges from [0, 0, 0, 0] to [1, 1, 1, 1] in vector form.
member.remarks: This struct is fully mutable. This is done (against the guidelines) for the sake of performance, as it avoids the need to create new values for modification operations.
member.content: Provides optimized overrides for bulk operations.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Processing.KnownFilterMatrices.CreateBrightnessFilter(System.Single)
member.summary: Create a brightness filter matrix using the given amount.
member.remarks: A value of 0 will create an image that is completely black. A value of 1 leaves the input unchanged. Other values are linear multipliers on the effect. Values of an amount over 1 are allowed, providing brighter results.
member.param: The proportion of the conversion. Must be greater than or equal to 0.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Processing.KnownFilterMatrices.CreateContrastFilter(System.Single)
member.summary: Create a contrast filter matrix using the given amount.
member.remarks: A value of 0 will create an image that is completely gray. A value of 1 leaves the input unchanged. Other values are linear multipliers on the effect. Values of an amount over 1 are allowed, providing results with more contrast.
member.param: The proportion of the conversion. Must be greater than or equal to 0.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Processing.KnownFilterMatrices.CreateGrayscaleBt601Filter(System.Single)
member.summary: Create a grayscale filter matrix using the given amount using the formula as specified by ITU-R Recommendation BT.601.
member.param: The proportion of the conversion. Must be between 0 and 1.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Processing.KnownFilterMatrices.CreateGrayscaleBt709Filter(System.Single)
member.summary: Create a grayscale filter matrix using the given amount using the formula as specified by ITU-R Recommendation BT.709.
member.param: The proportion of the conversion. Must be between 0 and 1.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Processing.KnownFilterMatrices.CreateHueFilter(System.Single)
member.summary: Create a hue filter matrix using the given angle in degrees.
member.param: The angle of rotation in degrees.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Processing.KnownFilterMatrices.CreateInvertFilter(System.Single)
member.summary: Create an invert filter matrix using the given amount.
member.param: The proportion of the conversion. Must be between 0 and 1.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Processing.KnownFilterMatrices.CreateOpacityFilter(System.Single)
member.summary: Create an opacity filter matrix using the given amount.
member.param: The proportion of the conversion. Must be between 0 and 1.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Processing.KnownFilterMatrices.CreateSaturateFilter(System.Single)
member.summary: Create a saturation filter matrix using the given amount.
member.remarks: A value of 0 is completely un-saturated. A value of 1 leaves the input unchanged. Other values are linear multipliers on the effect. Values of amount over 1 are allowed, providing super-saturated results
member.param: The proportion of the conversion. Must be greater than or equal to 0.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Processing.KnownFilterMatrices.CreateSepiaFilter(System.Single)
member.summary: Create a sepia filter matrix using the given amount. The formula used matches the svg specification.
member.param: The proportion of the conversion. Must be between 0 and 1.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Processing.KnownQuantizers
member.summary: Contains reusable static instances of known quantizing algorithms

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Processing.KnownQuantizers.Octree
member.summary: Gets the adaptive Octree quantizer. Fast with good quality. The quantizer only supports a single alpha value.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Processing.KnownQuantizers.Wu
member.summary: Gets the Xiaolin Wu's Color Quantizer which generates high quality output. The quantizer supports multiple alpha values.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Processing.KnownQuantizers.Palette
member.summary: Gets the palette based, Using the collection of web-safe colors. The quantizer supports multiple alpha values.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Processing.KnownResamplers
member.summary: Contains reusable static instances of known resampling algorithms

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Processing.KnownResamplers.Bicubic
member.summary: Gets the Bicubic sampler that implements the bicubic kernel algorithm W(x)

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Processing.KnownResamplers.Box
member.summary: Gets the Box sampler that implements the box algorithm. Similar to nearest neighbor when upscaling. When downscaling the pixels will average, merging pixels together.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Processing.KnownResamplers.CatmullRom
member.summary: Gets the Catmull-Rom sampler, a well known standard Cubic Filter often used as a interpolation function

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Processing.KnownResamplers.Hermite
member.summary: Gets the Hermite sampler. A type of smoothed triangular interpolation filter that rounds off strong edges while preserving flat 'color levels' in the original image.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Processing.KnownResamplers.Lanczos2
member.summary: Gets the Lanczos kernel sampler that implements smooth interpolation with a radius of 2 pixels. This algorithm provides sharpened results when compared to others when downsampling.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Processing.KnownResamplers.Lanczos3
member.summary: Gets the Lanczos kernel sampler that implements smooth interpolation with a radius of 3 pixels This algorithm provides sharpened results when compared to others when downsampling.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Processing.KnownResamplers.Lanczos5
member.summary: Gets the Lanczos kernel sampler that implements smooth interpolation with a radius of 5 pixels This algorithm provides sharpened results when compared to others when downsampling.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Processing.KnownResamplers.Lanczos8
member.summary: Gets the Lanczos kernel sampler that implements smooth interpolation with a radius of 8 pixels This algorithm provides sharpened results when compared to others when downsampling.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Processing.KnownResamplers.MitchellNetravali
member.summary: Gets the Mitchell-Netravali sampler. This seperable cubic algorithm yields a very good equilibrium between detail preservation (sharpness) and smoothness.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Processing.KnownResamplers.NearestNeighbor
member.summary: Gets the Nearest-Neighbour sampler that implements the nearest neighbor algorithm. This uses a very fast, unscaled filter which will select the closest pixel to the new pixels position.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Processing.KnownResamplers.Robidoux
member.summary: Gets the Robidoux sampler. This algorithm developed by Nicolas Robidoux providing a very good equilibrium between detail preservation (sharpness) and smoothness comprable to .

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Processing.KnownResamplers.RobidouxSharp
member.summary: Gets the Robidoux Sharp sampler. A sharpend form of the sampler

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Processing.KnownResamplers.Spline
member.summary: Gets the Spline sampler. A seperable cubic algorithm similar to but yielding smoother results.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Processing.KnownResamplers.Triangle
member.summary: Gets the Triangle sampler, otherwise known as Bilinear. This interpolation algorithm can be used where perfect image transformation with pixel matching is impossible, so that one can calculate and assign appropriate intensity values to pixels

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Processing.KnownResamplers.Welch
member.summary: Gets the Welch sampler. A high speed algorthm that delivers very sharpened results.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Processing.Processors.Quantization.WuFrameQuantizer`1
member.summary: An implementation of Wu's color quantizer with alpha channel.

remarks.para: Based on C Implementation of Xiaolin Wu's Color Quantizer (v. 2) (see Graphics Gems volume II, pages 126-133) ().
This adaptation is based on the excellent JeremyAnsel.ColorQuant by Jrmy Ansel

Algorithm: Greedy orthogonal bipartition of RGB space for variance minimization aided by inclusion-exclusion tricks. For speed no nearest neighbor search is done. Slightly better performance can be expected by more sophisticated but more expensive versions.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Processing.Processors.Quantization.WuFrameQuantizer`1.Get3DMoments(GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Memory.MemoryAllocator)
member.summary: Converts the histogram into moments so that we can rapidly calculate the sums of the above quantities over any desired box.
member.param: The memory allocator used for allocating buffers.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Processing.Processors.Quantization.WuFrameQuantizer`1.Variance(GrapeCity.Documents.Imaging.SixLabors.Processing.Processors.Quantization.WuFrameQuantizer{`0}.Box@)
member.summary: Computes the weighted variance of a box cube.

We want to minimize the sum of the variances of two sub-boxes. The sum(c^2) terms can be ignored since their sum over both sub-boxes is the same (the sum for the whole box) no matter where we split. The remaining terms have a minus sign in the variance formula, so we drop the minus sign and maximize the sum of the two terms.
